Docs.summary: Describes a position which can be an absolute value, a percentage, centered, or relative to the ending dimension. Integer values are implicitly convertible to an absolute Pos. These objects are created using the static methods Percent, AnchorEnd and Center. The Pos objects can be combined with the addition and subtraction operators.

remarks.para: Use the Pos objects on the X or Y properties of a view to control the position.

These can be used to set the absolute position, when merely assigning an integer value (via the implicit integer to Pos conversion), and they can be combined to produce more useful layouts, like: Pos.Center - 3, which would shift the postion of the view 3 characters to the left after centering for example.
